definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: He hurried on, lest he should drop out in the forced match.
sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，生怕在急行军中掉队。

sentences.english: The derro make haste to their new settlement at a forced march.
sentences.chinese: 迪洛矮人向新定居点急行军。

sentences.english: A spectacular march in four days brought them within ten miles of the capital, Yunnanfu.
sentences.chinese: 他们在四天急行军后到达距省会云南府十英里处。

sentences.english: The platoon will have to march in double time to get back to base before nightfall.
sentences.chinese: 这个排必须急行军以在天黑前赶回基地。

sentences.english: In inky darkness the men made a forced march of 40 miles.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们在一片漆黑中急行军40英里。

definition: to set out (of troops)/departure/start date (of military expedition)
to travel at double speed/to make all haste
to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
